alert.note: Alert for La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 9:45AM CST until February 25 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at Ottawa affecting La Salle County. For the Illinois River (Upper)...including Ottawa...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River at Ottawa. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 464.0 feet, backwater causes the Fox River to reach bankfull near St. Elizabeth Medical Center in Ottawa. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 462.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 463.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 463.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected around 345 AM CST late tonight.
